contextId.information: AT: "no one is able to build a house for God because the nothing can contain him. I am no one! Only a person who can offer sacrifices to him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: who is able to build God a house, since the entire universe and even heaven itself cannot contain him? Who am I to build him a house, except to burn sacrifices before him?

contextId.information: AT: "But God, surely you will not actually live with mankind on the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: But will God actually live with mankind on the earth?

contextId.information: "they are written ... Jeroboam son of Nebat." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: are they not written ... Jeroboam son of Nebat?

contextId.information: "We do not want anything to do with this descendant of King David!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: What share do we have in David?

contextId.information: AT: "they are recorded ... Jeroboam." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: are they not written ... Jeroboam?

contextId.information: AT: "You have driven ... Levites." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Have you not driven ... Levites?

contextId.information: AT: "The Ethiopians and the Libyans were a huge army, with very many chariots and horsemen." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Were not the Ethiopians and the Libyans a huge army, with very many chariots and horsemen?

contextId.information: "I am sure there must be here ... advice." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is there not here ... advice?

contextId.information: AT: "I told you to only speak the truth in the name of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: How many times must I require you to swear to tell me nothing but the truth in the name of Yahweh?

contextId.information: AT: "I told you that he would prophesy that disaster would come to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Did I not tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but only disaster?

contextId.information: AT: "You should not help the wicked! You should not love those who hate Yahweh!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Should you be helping the wicked? Should you be loving those who hate Yahweh?

contextId.information: AT: "You are indeed God in heaven and the ruler over all the kings of the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: are you not God in heaven? Are you not the ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations?

contextId.information: AT: "please judge them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: will you not judge them?

contextId.information: "You have behaved wickedly. I told you to require the Levites ... covenant decrees, but you have not done it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why have you not required the Levites ... covenant decrees?

contextId.information: AT: "You have worshiped the gods of a people that did not even save their own people from you, King Amaziah." (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why have you sought after the gods of a people who did not even save their own people from your hand

contextId.information: AT: "you should not cause yourself trouble and fall, both you and Judah with you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: for why should you cause yourself trouble and fall, both you and Judah with you?

contextId.information: AT: "But remember, you are guilty ... against Yahweh your God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: But are you not guilty ... against Yahweh your God?

contextId.information: The kings of Assyria should not come and find a lot of water. Translators may want to translate "the king of Assyria," but they should translate "the kings of Assyria," because there is no support for a textual reading of "the king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why should the kings of Assyria come and find a lot of water?

contextId.information: AT: "Hezekiah is misleading you ... when he tells you, 'Yahweh ... Assyria.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is not Hezekiah misleading you ... when he tells you, 'Yahweh ... Assyria'?

contextId.information: "You know very well what ... lands!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Do you not know what ... lands?

contextId.information: "There was no god among all the gods ... who ... hand!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Among all the gods ... was there any god who ... hand?
